We bring more than just humanitarian aid
We bring a sense of hope

TOGETHER FOR HUMANITY

We are a group of Ukrainian volunteers working tirelessly to help our fellow citizens living near the front lines. Every day, we work to identify the most pressing needs and deliver relief to those who are caught in dangerous and desperate situations

Every single day, we provide aid for:

  • Hospitals
  • Liberated villages
  • Those in the closed zones
  • Displaced and divided families
  • Refugee centers
  • Elderly care homes
  • Orphanages
  • Dog shelters
What we do

We bring hope

meet the team

Coming together from a wide variety of backgrounds, our team of volunteers is the backbone of STAY SAFE UA. Their dedication to the hard work, everyday, in c hallenging conditions, made it possible to help hundreds of people in need. Read on to learn more about who we are.

SOCIAL MEDIA

OUR ACTIONS

Check out some of our recent actions below and learn more about our efforts!

Supporting Newborn Triplets!

On a trip to the city of Kharkhiv at the beginning of July, several of our volunteers were put in contact with a couple living in the nearby village of Odnorobivka. For several years, this couple had been trying to have children – and now they were soon expecting triplets! The mother had just been moved into the regional hospital in the city of Poltava and was expected to give birth at the beginning of August.

View more

The Social Pharmacy at Zolochiv Hospital

For the past six months, we at STAY SAFE UA have delivered medical supplies to local hospitals around the regions of Kharkiv and the Donbas. These hospitals have been in close proximity to the front lines during the course of the Russian invasion, with some being just 3 kilometers away from the fighting! As a result, these hospitals, such as the one located in the town of Zolochiv are now the first point of medical help for wounded Ukrainian soldiers.

View more

Bringing an Electrical Generator to the Village

Last July, while on a delivery trip to the northwestern village of Baranivka, our team of volunteers discovered that the entire village no longer had access to electricity. Without electricity, people’s lights no longer worked, the heating systems had shut off and there was no longer running water in any of the houses. Under normal circumstances, the village’s water is supplied by a nearby river, which is pumped up into a water tower and then distributed throughout the households. However, without electricity, the pump had ceased to function.

View more

photo reports

Click on the photo to find out more

Here, our volunteers pose with the mayor of this small village located on the outskirts of the eastern city of Kharkiv. We brought over three pallets of food boxes to distribute among the inhabitants there.

As we distribute food boxes, our volunteers often chat with the locals to hear how they are doing, and the current problems they are facing.

Our volunteer Taras helps a villager to carry an electrical generator over to a nearby water tower. There, the generator will power a pump that will give this village access to running water.

Here’s always time during a delivery trip to cuddle with a puppy!

Taras unwraps the last pallet of food boxes that we have brought to the rural village of Baranivka. Each box contains long-lasting items like flour, pasta, canned meat, and beans.
